articles.summary: India's upcoming Union Budget 2026 is poised to bolster its status as a global hub for Global Capability Centres (GCCs), projected to contribute $199 billion by 2030. Policy support, including tax incentives and streamlined regulations, is crucial for this sector's expansion into innovation and business delivery. States are actively supporting GCCs, with a national policy framework further reinforcing this momentum.

articles.summary: Budget 2026: India may introduce incentive packages totaling up to ₹23,000 crore in the union budget for FY 2026-27 to boost domestic manufacturing of high-value capital goods. Schemes for construction equipment and automotive sectors are nearing finalization, aiming to reduce import reliance and strengthen global value chains.

articles.title: Budget's rare chance: Leveraging the new oil beneath India’s feet
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: India possesses significant rare earth reserves, crucial for future industries like EVs and semiconductors. The government is actively promoting this sector through new missions and policy reforms. Budget 2025-26 can further boost rare earth processing and magnet manufacturing. This strategic focus aims to enhance India's economic growth and global influence.

Markets are focused on the U.S. Supreme Court verdict on Trump’s tariffs, which could have a major impact on India–U.S. trade relations and domestic market sentiment.

articles.title: Markets brace for Supreme Court verdict on Trump’s emergency tariffs
articles.summary: A pending US Supreme Court ruling on Donald Trump’s emergency tariff powers could spark sharp market moves. Striking down the levies may boost equities and corporate cash flows but raise bond yields, while alternative tariff routes could limit lasting impact, keeping fiscal and market uncertainty elevated.

articles.title: Sensex, Nifty turn red after early gains as US tariffs keep investors on toes
articles.summary: Indian equities opened higher on Friday but quickly turned lower as investors adopted a cautious stance. The Sensex and Nifty experienced marginal declines within minutes of trading. This cautious sentiment stems from anticipation of a U.S. Supreme Court ruling on the legality of U.S. tariffs, which have recently impacted market performance.

articles.summary: Budget session: The government plans to introduce the Seeds Bill 2025 in Parliament in February. This new bill will replace the old Seeds Act of 1966. It aims to ensure seed quality and traceability through mandatory registration. Farmers will still be able to save and exchange their own seeds. The bill also outlines penalties for violations.

articles.summary: Shashi Tharoor, while respecting Jawaharlal Nehru as India's democratic founder, acknowledged his mistakes, stating the Modi government unfairly scapegoats him. He noted the 1962 China war defeat as a potential Nehru misstep, but criticized blaming him for all current issues. Tharoor also shared personal anecdotes about his writing journey and Kerala's reading culture.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Capex in the driver’s seat of India’s growth story
articles.summary: Budget 2026: With the FY2027 Union Budget looming, there lies a crucial opportunity for the government to concentrate on amplifying domestic potential and fostering growth. Elevating capital expenditure is key to improving infrastructure and spurring private investments. A renewed spotlight on production-linked incentive schemes can galvanise the National Manufacturing Mission, serving as a lifeline for MSMEs and innovative startups.

articles.title: No call from PM Modi to Trump blocked India-US trade deal, US commerce secy says
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick claimed that a stalled India-US trade deal was due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi not calling President Donald Trump. Lutnick stated the deal required leader-to-leader political signaling, which did not occur, leading to India's discomfort and the lack of a call.

articles.title: Trump's 500% tariff threat more of a pressure tactic: Oil industry
articles.summary: In a striking political maneuver, US President Donald Trump is endorsing legislation that would impose a staggering 500% tariff on Russian oil purchasers. Indian oil executives perceive this as a tactical pressure play in ongoing trade negotiations rather than a serious ultimatum. The intention appears to be to coerce India while nudging Russia towards a more peaceful resolution.

articles.title: 500% Trump Tariffs? India could pay the price on Russian oil sanctions while China cruises free
articles.summary: A proposed sanctions bill in the US is set to deliver heavy tariffs on nations importing inexpensive Russian oil. India could face significant repercussions, while China appears insulated from these measures.

articles.title: Budget 2026: How India can mobilise capital for its next growth leap
articles.summary: Union Budget: Policy and regulatory support helped boost consumption in 2025, reflected in strong GST collections and higher retail credit, aided by income tax relief, GST rate rationalisation and a cumulative 125-basis-point repo rate cut by the RBI. Retail lending led credit growth, while bank credit is expected to grow 11–12% and NBFC/HFC lending 18–19% this fiscal. However, weak deposit mobilisation and sluggish private investment remain concerns.

articles.title: Leather exports hit by US tariffs: Industry tells Parl panel
articles.summary: The Indian leather industry met with a Parliamentary Standing Committee on Commerce, highlighting that 50% US tariffs are significantly harming exports and impacting the sector's competitiveness. They urged for bilateral engagements to address trade barriers and requested policy and diplomatic support to mitigate socio-economic consequences.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal invites Liechtenstein investment in India
articles.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal urged Liechtenstein companies to invest in India, leveraging the India-EFTA trade pact for expansion. He highlighted India's scale, talent, and manufacturing depth, complementing Liechtenstein's specialized industrial and financial expertise. The minister encouraged collaboration to build resilient value chains and a reliable investment bridge in a volatile global environment.

articles.title: GDP growth to slip to 6.8% in FY27, limited scope for rate cuts: Report
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs forecasts India's GDP growth to slow to 6.8 percent in FY27. Inflation is expected to rise, restricting the Reserve Bank's ability to lower interest rates. Private investment remains subdued. The rupee's depreciation is likely nearing its end. The current account deficit is projected at 1 percent in 2026. A US-India trade deal delay could pressure the currency.

articles.title: FTA with India to boost exports and open doors for farmers, businesses: New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon
articles.summary: New Zealand and India have concluded a Free Trade Agreement. This pact is set to boost exports and create jobs for New Zealand. The deal aims to enhance market access and promote investment. It is expected to take effect in seven to eight months. This agreement signifies a significant step in strengthening bilateral economic ties between the two nations.

articles.title: Ramesh Juneja assumes charge as Chairman of Council for Leather Exports
articles.summary: Ramesh Juneja has taken over as the new Chairman of the Council for Leather Exports. The organization sees significant growth potential for India's leather and footwear exports. Bilateral trade agreements with the EU and US could boost exports to $14 billion in the next 3-5 years. Currently, exports stand at around $5.5 billion.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal’s two-day visit to EU to give decisive push to conclude FTA
articles.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will visit Brussels from January 8-9 to meet EU Commissioner Maroš Šefčovič, aiming to expedite the conclusion of the India-EU Free Trade Agreement. The discussions will focus on resolving outstanding issues and securing tangible benefits for India's labor-intensive sectors.

articles.title: US Supreme Court verdict on Trump tariff tonight: How Sensex, Nifty may get impacted
articles.summary: The US Supreme Court ruling on Trump-era tariffs could spark sharp gains or deepen volatility in Sensex and Nifty. India faces double exposure with 50% tariffs and a potential 500% levy on Russian oil imports, affecting trade and corporate profits.

articles.title: Export-heavy stocks slide up to 11% as Trump threatens 500% tariff; Avanti Feeds, Kitex Garments lead losses
articles.summary: Export-oriented stocks, including Kitex Garments and Avanti Feeds, declined for a second day as US political signals raised fears of higher trade barriers. A bipartisan Russia sanctions bill, potentially impacting India's trade with Russia, intensified selling pressure. Seafood and textile exporters faced significant drops amid concerns of disrupted shipments and weaker US demand.

articles.title: 2025: A milestone in India-Singapore relations
articles.summary: India and Singapore marked 60 years of diplomatic relations in 2025. High-level visits by leaders from both nations strengthened their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. A roadmap was unveiled to deepen trade and market access. Defence cooperation saw significant engagements, including maritime exercises. Various ministerial and parliamentary delegations also exchanged visits, underscoring the robust bilateral ties.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,750 amid trade pact worries
articles.summary: Indian stocks extended losses for a fourth session on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty falling amid U.S.-India trade deal uncertainty. However, a rebound in the rupee and renewed foreign investor buying offered some support. Global markets also saw declines, particularly in technology shares, while oil prices advanced due to geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: India’s power sector may see limited impact if Chinese curbs are scrapped: PL Capital
articles.summary: Amit Anwani of PL Capital said any easing of Chinese import restrictions is unlikely to be broad-based and will depend on government notification. He said government-led power orders and localisation reduce risks for domestic players like BHEL, while transmission companies could see limited margin impact. Execution and balance sheet strength remain key factors to watch.

articles.title: US-India trade deal didn't happen because PM Modi didn't call President Trump, claims Lutnick
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary claimed in the podcast interview that India could have had a lower tariff than Indonesia, Vietnam and others if the deal was closed earlier.

articles.title: Top Stories | Markets shed ₹8 lakh cr, Trump’s 500% tariff threat, Noida airport telecom tussle & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10—CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights—delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet clears ₹10 hike on liquor prices, eases burden on bars
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet led by N Chandrababu Naidu hikes IMFL MRP by ₹10, eases bar taxes, permits microbreweries, and launches APLINC and Andhra Pradesh Logistics Fund for infrastructure growth.

articles.title: How Indians earned in 2025: ClearTax's ITR filing report reveals shift to multi-source income
articles.summary: ClearTax’s 2025 report shows India’s shift to multi-income sources, with millennials and Gen Z driving growth in business, trading, investments, and digital assets, especially via ITR-2 and ITR-3.

articles.title: India-US Trade Deal: 'Modi needed to call Trump' for India-US trade deal to reach conclusion
articles.summary: India-US Trade Deal: 'Modi needed to call Trump' for India-US trade deal to reach conclusion

articles.title: Trump’s Russia oil crackdown: Why India faces the threat of 500% US tariffs
articles.summary: With the US President backing a Bill to penalise buyers of Russian oil, India could face US tariffs of at least 500%, turning energy security into a high-stakes trade flashpoint.

articles.title: SC sets aside HC order nullifying graft cases
articles.summary: The Supreme Court revived corruption cases in Andhra Pradesh, criticizing the high court's "hyper technical" ruling that quashed FIRs under the PC Act.

articles.title: ‘Hug hug na raha’: Congress takes dig at PM Modi; reacts to stalled India–US trade deal
articles.summary: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticised the BJP-led Centre, citing US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick's comments that India missed a trade deal with the US due to a lack of direct leadership engagement. Lutnick claimed Prime Minister Modi did not personally call then-President Trump, stalling advanced negotiations. The US subsequently finalized deals with other regional countries.

articles.title: Expert’s view: Budget 2026 should aim to establish a stable tax environment and propel growth
articles.summary: Budget 2026: EY-India outlined certain direct tax reforms, which if introduced, could unlock private capital, enhance competitiveness, and support inclusive economic growth.

articles.title: ‘PM Modi did not call Trump’: US Commerce secretary makes big statement — explains why India-US trade deal is stuck
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick stated PM Modi's failure to call President Trump prevented a trade deal. This comes as the US imposes tariffs on countries buying Russian oil. India faces tariffs on its goods. Both nations are negotiating a comprehensive trade agreement with a goal to significantly boost bilateral trade by 2030.

नमामी गंगे मिशन के दूसरे चरण के तहत गंगा और यमुना नदियों के लिए पांच प्रमुख सीवरेज अवसंरचना परियोजनाएं शुरू की गईं
मैंग्रोव इनिशिएटिव फॉर शोरलाइन हैबिटेट्स एंड टैंजिबल इनकम’ (मिष्टि) योजना पर राष्ट्रीय स्तर की कार्यशाला विजयवाड़ा, आंध्र प्रदेश में आयोजित
प्रधानमंत्री श्री नरेन्द्र मोदी 10-11 जनवरी को गुजरात के सोमनाथ की यात्रा पर रहेंगे और सोमनाथ स्वाभिमान पर्व में भाग लेंगे
प्रधानमंत्री 11 जनवरी को राजकोट जाएंगे
प्रधानमंत्री, जर्मन चांसलर मर्ज़ से 12 जनवरी को अहमदाबाद में भेंट करेंगे
प्रधानमंत्री 10 से 12 जनवरी तक गुजरात का दौरा करेंगे
प्रधानमंत्री ने प्रवासी भारतीय दिवस के अवसर पर विश्वभर में बसे भारतीय समुदाय को शुभकामनाएं दीं
भारतीय दूरसंचार नियामक प्रधिकरण ने सोनीपत शहर और उसके आसपास के क्षेत्रों में मोबाइल की गुणवत्ता का आकलन किया
भारत के डेयरी क्षेत्र का डिजिटल कायाकल्प
आईएनएस चिल्का में प्रशिक्षुओं के बैच 02/25 की पासिंग आउट परेड
प्रधानमंत्री ने राष्ट्र की सामूहिक चेतना को जागृत करने में सोमनाथ धाम की शाश्वत भूमिका को एक सुभाषित के माध्यम से रेखांकित किया
राष्ट्रीय खेल बोर्ड (खोज-सह-चयन समिति) नियम, 2026 की अधिसूचना
केन्द्रीय गृह एवं सहकारिता मंत्री श्री अमित शाह ने आज नई दिल्ली में जम्मू-कश्मीर पर एक सुरक्षा समीक्षा बैठक की अध्यक्षता की

केंद्रीय मंत्री नितिन गडकरी ने इस बात पर जोर दिया कि नीतिगत सामंजस्य सुनिश्चित करने, सहकारी संघवाद को मजबूत करने और देश भर में कुशल, सुरक्षित और नागरिक केंद्रित परिवहन समाधान प्रदान करने के लिए नियमित परामर्श आवश्यक हैं
सामाजिक न्याय और अधिकारिता विभाग ने ट्रांसजेंडर व्यक्तियों और भिखारियों के लिए कल्याण और पुनर्वास के उपायों पर समीक्षा बैठक की
उत्तर पूर्वी क्षेत्र सम्मेलन: वस्त्र मंत्रालय ने प्रगति की समीक्षा की और उत्तर पूर्वी राज्यों में वस्त्र उद्योग की वृद्धि को गति देने के लिए कार्यसूची तैयार की
वस्त्र समिति और एनईएचएचडीसी ने जीआई पंजीकरण और पोस्ट-जीआई पहलों के माध्यम से बौद्धिक संपदा अधिकारों (आईपीआर) संरक्षण पर समझौता ज्ञापन पर हस्ताक्षर किए।
पारादीप पत्तन पर 25वां अखिल भारतीय प्रमुख पत्तन सांस्कृतिक सम्मेलन शुरू
केंद्र ने तमिलनाडु में 235 करोड़ रुपये की पत्तन परियोजनाएं शुरू कीं;
52 हफ्तों में 52 सुधार: भारतीय रेलवे में दक्षता, संचालन और सेवा वितरण में व्यापक सुधार लाने वाले प्रमुख सुधार

articles.summary: As per district administration of 60 injured workers 42 were admitted in district hospital Gopeshwar while 17 were under treatment Vivekanand hospital in Pipalkoti. About four-five workers in the district hospital are with bone fracture injuries. Most of the workers received minor injuries while five to six workers suffered severe injuries. Condition of all of the affected workers is reported to be stable. The tunnel work was stopped following the incident.

articles.title: 2025: Silt accumulation in Indian Dams: Reducing entry of silt is the only viable option
articles.summary: Unfortunately, once silt is inside the large dam storage, there is no economically viable way to remove it. But the governments seem least bothered about reducing the entry of silt into the reservoir by maintaining better catchment health and ensuring that upstream projects do not dump silt into the river. Talking, planning about silt removal from the dams have remained just that so far: Talks. We still lack a national silt management policy and credible action plan.

articles.title: TREADS: Transboundary Rivers, Ecologies & Development Studies
articles.summary: TREADS programme encompasses and echoes our research and policy interests in transboundary political ecologies, river water governance and development studies. We are interested in politics and ecologies (relationships) across boundaries – after Neil Smith’s “markers of difference” – at different scales. We pursue our interests in this generic sense of transboundary political spaces, at present focused primarily on transboundary river water governance.

articles.summary: The Karnataka District Judiciary Reforms Bill 2025 is the most recent attempt at judicial reform in the state. In 2024, the legislature enacted amendments to the Civil Procedure Code (CPC), introducing case management hearings in district courts, bef...Read more at: https://www.deccanherald.com/opinion/fast-track-courts-may-not-be-the-cure-3816439

articles.title: Karnataka’s new case clock: Can time-bound justice deliver?
articles.summary: The Karnataka government recently passed a state amendment to the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 (CPC) and introduced case management hearings in civil trials. Case management hearings are widely used across the world to streamline court proceedings by setting clear timelines for completing various stages of a case.

articles.title: Civil Disputes, Criminal Justice Resolutions
articles.summary: In this piece, Lakshmi Menon examines how delays, bottlenecks, and weak enforcement in civil courts drive lawyers and litigants to misuse criminal law for quicker settlements. She highlights the unpopularity of civil courts, the systemic nature of the problem and argues that real change lies not in blaming individuals but in pursuing institutional reforms to strengthen our civil courts.

articles.title: Set the guardrails for AI use in courtrooms
articles.summary: In July this year, the Kerala High Court published a set of guidelines for Artificial Intelligence (AI) use by the district judiciary (“Policy Regarding Use of Artificial Intelligence Tools in District Judiciary”). As the first policy in the country directly addressing AI use in judicial processes and setting out strict safeguards, it is timely.

articles.title: Why ICAI’s audit limit is misguided and outdated
articles.summary: From FY 2027, each partner in a CA firm will be allowed to sign no more than 60 tax audit reports a year—a proposal the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) says will “improve audit quality and manage workload.”

articles.title: Mapping Judicial Time: A Two-by-Two Framework for Categorising Listings
articles.summary: In this blog post, Gokul Krishnan R proposes a novel two-by-two framework for categorising case listings in Indian trial courts. The framework classifies listings based on their nature (procedural or substantive) and their effectiveness in advancing cases toward resolution. This approach provides a nuanced understanding of judicial time utilisation, moving beyond traditional definitions of "effective hearing".

articles.title: Section 270A Penalty Case Remanded After Delay Condoned

articles.summary: It was ruled that speculative losses from non-genuine share transactions cannot be adjusted against interest income. articles.title: CIT(A) Must Decide All Grounds Before Confirming TDS Disallowance
articles.summary: The matter was sent back as the appellate authority did not examine the plea for allowance in the year of later TDS payment. articles.title: Accrued MACT Interest Cannot Be Taxed When Award Is Under Appeal
articles.summary: Where compensation and interest are deposited under judicial custody due to a pending appeal, no real income accrues. articles.title: Coal Transport Expense Disallowance Fails Without Contrary Evidence
articles.summary: It was held that transport charges cannot be disallowed when PAN-based TDS, ledger matching, and banking trails exist. articles.title: Employee Not Liable for Employer’s Failure to Deposit Salary TDS
articles.summary: The tribunal rejected demand raised solely due to Form 26AS mismatch caused by employer non-deposit of TDS. The key principle is that employees cannot be penalised for failures beyond their control. The post Employee Not Liable for Employer’s Failure to Deposit Salary TDS appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Assessment Reopened on Alleged Cash Deposits That Did Not Exist
articles.summary: The reopening relied on a bank account number that did not match the account from which transactions were considered. articles.title: Delay in Form 10AB Filing Held Condonable Under Section 12AB
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that minor delay in filing Form 10AB cannot justify rejection when law permits condonation. Commissioners must examine reasonable cause instead of dismissing applications on technical grounds. The post Delay in Form 10AB Filing Held Condonable Under Section 12AB appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 69C Not Applicable to Salary/Wages Disallowance Where Source Is Explained
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that section 69C cannot be invoked when expenditure is recorded in books and its source is not in doubt, even if part of the claim is disallowed. articles.title: GST Recovery Cannot Be Made from a Separate Company Merely Due to Common Director
articles.summary: The High Court set aside a GST garnishee notice where tax dues of one company were recovered from another independent entity. articles.title: Sales to Merchant Exporters Without GST: Guide to Notif. 40/2017 & 41/2017

articles.title: Supply Under GST: A Complete, Practical & Exam‑Oriented Guide

articles.title: Second Reopening u/s 147 Quashed as Change of Opinion—Section 54F Deduction Cannot Be Revisited Without New Material

articles.title: Reassessment After Four Years Invalid for Change of Opinion: ITAT Chennai

articles.title: CLB Lacked Power to Condon Delay Under Companies Act 2013: SC

articles.title: ITAT Mumbai Quashed Cash Addition Based Only on Third-Party Excel Sheet
