articles.summary: Political sparring intensifies with a jibe at Akhilesh Yadav, while a former Trinamool leader criticizes Mamata Banerjee. International news includes NASA's diamond-planet discovery and a former child star's homelessness. Sports headlines feature Usman Khawaja's family facing abuse, and business news highlights soaring gold prices and Thailand's popularity as an Indian holiday spot.

articles.title: Vivek Ramaswamy mauled in MAGA bloodletting as Trump devotees turn on each other
articles.summary: A conservative conference saw prominent MAGA figures engage in bitter public disputes. Vivek Ramaswamy faced backlash for his remarks on anti-Indian hate. Ben Shapiro criticized Tucker Carlson and Candace Owens. Steve Bannon also attacked Shapiro. The event became a spectacle of internal conflict, with accusations of antisemitism and conspiracy theories dominating the proceedings.

articles.title: India fast-tracks key reforms to shield itself from US tariffs
articles.summary: In its final parliament session of the year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government pushed through major economic reforms aimed at boosting growth amid trade challenges. Parliament approved bills allowing private investment in nuclear energy, full foreign ownership of insurance firms, and a unified securities market code.

articles.title: India valuations fair, earnings key to upside over next 12 months: Mark Matthews
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are poised for steady, healthy growth, driven by the gradual payoff of fiscal and monetary stimulus. While global markets face volatility, India's lack of an AI boom may position it as a favored diversification destination for cyclical exposure. Expect earnings-led returns rather than valuation rerating.

articles.title: Catching the Market’s Swing: How traders ride market moves across India, US and global bourses
articles.summary: Swing trading sits comfortably between long-term investing and high-frequency day trading, appealing to market participants who want to capture short- to medium-term price movements without being glued to screens all day.

articles.title: India’s growth story intact despite FII outflows, sentiment the key risk: Jim Walker
articles.summary: Market strategist Jim Walker expresses astonishment at foreign investors selling Indian equities, deeming it a "madness" given India's status as the world's fastest-growing major economy. He believes recent selling is profit-taking, with investors likely to regret overlooking India's long-term fundamentals and domestic growth drivers.

articles.title: Nasdaq is planning for near 24-hour trading. What does it mean for Indian stock markets?
articles.summary: Nasdaq’s plan for 24x7 trading could change how Indian markets absorb global cues, with price discovery becoming continuous rather than overnight. Experts say this may raise opening gaps and short-term volatility in globally sensitive sectors, even as India’s long-term market drivers remain largely domestic.

articles.title: School News Assembly Headlines for December 15, 2025: Top national, international, sports and business update
articles.summary: News headlines for December 15: Delhi schools are now operating in a hybrid mode due to pollution. Prime Minister Modi embarks on a visit to Jordan. New tourism facilities have opened in Kashmir. The BJP has a new national working president. A mass shooting occurred in Sydney. India leads South Africa in the T20 series. The Odisha Masters badminton tournament has concluded.

articles.title: BCCL sees workforce at 22,000 by 2030, wage hikes of 15–20% ahead
articles.summary: Coal India’s Director of Finance Mukesh Agrawal said Bharat Coking Coal is targeting a net profit of around ₹2,900 crore by 2030, which would translate into an EBITDA of over ₹5,000 crore.

articles.title: Better earnings may not mean big returns next year: HDFC Securities
articles.summary: Varun Lohchab said HDFC Securities remains overweight on financials, including banks and NBFCs. The firm is easing its underweight on consumer staples and IT towards neutral, while staying underweight on oil & gas and cement. Exposure to metals is being reduced to neutral or slightly underweight, and consumer discretionary remains marginally underweight.

articles.title: Skydo receives RBI’s final approval to operate as cross-border payment aggregator
articles.summary: Skydo receives RBI approval as Payment Aggregator–Cross Border, serving 30000 exporters in 50 cities, supporting 32 currencies, and expanding services after raising 20 million dollars in funding.

articles.title: Stock Market Crash: BSE-listed companies lose ₹15 lakh crore in worst week since September
articles.summary: All sectoral indices have reported losses for the week, led by the Nifty Energy index, which declined 5%. This has turned out to be the worst week for the index since February last year, when it had declined 7% for the week that ended on February 14.

articles.title: Motilal Oswal explains why gold and silver may stay firm in 2026
articles.summary: Motilal Oswal Financial Services reports gold and silver enter 2026 with strong support, driven by central-bank demand, currency shifts, and industrial use, making them key long-term portfolio assets.

articles.title: Parli civic body: AIMIM, Ajit Pawar and Eknath Shinde join hands for floor leader election in Maharashtra
articles.summary: In Parli Municipal Corporation, NCP Ajit Pawar, Shiv Sena Shinde, and AIMIM unite for floor leader, sparking debate and exposing rifts in Mahayuti ahead of Maharashtra civic polls.

articles.title: Godrej Properties, DLF fall up to 5% as Nifty Realty emerges the top sectoral loser
articles.summary: Realty and capital market goods stocks led sectoral losses, weighing heavily on overall sentiment.

articles.summary: Santanu Sengupta, Chief India Economist at Goldman Sachs, said urban credit growth has already started to recover, helped by regulatory easing from the RBI..

articles.summary: Iran faces nationwide protests over economic collapse and political legitimacy, with Reza Pahlavi urging global support and Donald Trump warning Tehran against violence amid internet shutdowns.

articles.title: Maharashtra civic polls: Fadnavis claims BJP alliance will have mayor in 27 out of 29 cities
articles.summary: Devendra Fadnavis predicts NDA mayors in 27 cities, clarifies alliances in Akola and Ambernath, and credits himself for Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray uniting for civic polls in Maharashtra.

articles.summary: VR Ramakrishnan and Reji Lukose, former CPI(M) members, join BJP ahead of Kerala assembly polls, citing disillusionment with CPI(M) and support for BJP's development politics.

articles.summary: Gold ETFs saw record net inflows of ₹11,646 crore in December, driven by macroeconomic uncertainty, rising gold prices, and strong investor demand, according to AMFI and Morningstar.

articles.summary: HDFC Bank shares have lost more than ₹1 lakh crore in market cap this week, which is turning out to be the worst one since January 2024.

CLSA prefers consumption, real estate and IT, and expects crude oil prices to recover towards $70, favouring upstream energy stocks.

articles.summary: Delhi court frames charges against Lalu Prasad Yadav, Rabri Devi, Misa Bharti, Hema Yadav, Tejaswi Yadav, and Tej Pratap Yadav in land for job scam, citing criminal syndicate allegations.

articles.summary: Net inflows into equity mutual fund schemes fell to ₹28,035 crore in December from ₹29,894 crore in November, as per Association of Mutual Funds in India data, showing a slight moderation.

articles.summary: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer condemned the incident as “disgraceful and unacceptable,” saying such content would not be tolerated. He stressed that the platform must take responsibility and rein the situation in, adding that media regulator Ofcom has the government’s full backing to act.

articles.title: Why India’s credit system needs accountability in distribution
articles.summary: Loans represent some of the largest and longest tenure financial decisions made by households and MSMEs, yet those intermediating these decisions face no market wide requirements for training, testing or continuing education, notes Shachindra Nath, Founder & Managing Director, UGRO Capital.

articles.title: Denmark orders ‘shoot first’ in case of US invasion of Greenland
articles.summary: The renewed tension comes after US President Trump again underlined Greenland’s strategic importance to the US, shortly after authorising a military operation against Venezuela’s president.

articles.title: AI Overviews, suggested personalised replies and more: What Gmail in Gemini era means
articles.summary: The Gmail update, announced by Google CEO Sundar Pichai on X, includes AI Overviews, Suggested Replies, Proofread, and AI Inbox, among other features.

articles.title: SEBI updates SIF reporting rules: What investors should know
articles.summary: SEBI introduces new compliance rules for Specialised Investment Funds, mandating detailed reporting by AMCs and trustees to boost transparency and investor protection for retail investors.

articles.title: US Supreme court likely to rule on Trump tariffs today; What is at stake here?
articles.summary: While it is not guaranteed that the Supreme Court will issue its verdict, it has designated Friday as a “decision day” for releasing opinions, and many anticipate that the tariff case will be addressed.

articles.title: Global cooperation showing resilience despite geopolitical headwinds: WEF study
articles.summary: The barometer indicated that the overall level of cooperation has largely been unchanged in recent years, but the composition of cooperation appears to be evolving.

articles.title: Most of Wall Street drifts as defence companies rocket higher
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 109 points, or 0.2 per cent, as of 9:35 am Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 0.4 per cent lower.

articles.title: GDP to grow by 7.5 pc in FY26, says SBI report
articles.summary: The First Advance Estimates released by the National Statistics Office (NSO) on Wednesday put GDP growth in 2025-26 at 7.4 per cent as compared to 6.5 per cent in the previous fiscal. The RBI has projected the growth rate at 7.3 per cent.

articles.title: Sanctions rhetoric vs market reality: Why oil prices may stay soft and Indian refiners could still gain
articles.summary: As Washington sharpens its sanctions language on Russian oil, analysts caution that structural oversupply, rising global inventories and pragmatic enforcement limits are likely to keep crude prices under pressure. For India, the evolving mix of discounted Russian barrels and softer heavy crude markets could translate into steadier feedstock costs and improved refining margins, even as geopolitical risks persist.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EY pitches TDS simplification for ease of doing business, seeks consolidation
articles.summary: EY has urged the government to simplify the tax deducted at source framework by sharply reducing the number of rates and eliminating low-rate TDS on GST-covered transactions, arguing that the current system creates avoidable compliance burdens without adding meaningful oversight.

articles.title: RBI data shows credit card spends growing, but pace moderates after festive season
articles.summary: India’s credit card spending remained in double digits in November despite post-festive moderation, driven by rising card penetration and strong e-commerce demand, while per-card spends eased and public sector banks gained market share, RBI data shows.

articles.title: US employment anomaly, not geopolitics, clouds 2026 global outlook: JPMorgan’s Aziz
articles.summary: Jahangir Aziz, Head of Emerging Markets Economic Research at JPMorgan, warned that without a revival in private capital expenditure, India’s growth will remain dependent on cyclical, government-led stimulus rather than shifting to a sustainable, higher growth trajectory.

articles.title: Substantial rise in wealth of Indian-origin adults in UK over past decade: Study
articles.summary: Median wealth rose "substantially" for Indian-origin adults in the UK even as the wealth gap between ethnic groups in the country widened significantly over the past decade, new research by the London School of Economics (LSE) has revealed.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP estimates hold up as economists assess what lies beneath
articles.summary: India’s FY26 GDP growth estimate of 7.4% reassures economists, but softer nominal expansion, fiscal maths and base effects explain why the headline number only tells part of the story.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP at 7.4% looks strong, but economists caution on soft nominal growth
articles.summary: India’s FY26 real GDP growth of 7.4% meets expectations, but economists warn that weaker nominal growth could weigh on earnings, fiscal math and market sentiment despite headline resilience.

articles.title: India’s 'Goldilocks' run to continue for next two years; FY27 growth likely at 6.5-7%: EAC-PM Chair
articles.summary: 'India has entered into FTAs with various trade partners which is contributing to diversification of exports. This adds to the overall resilience of exports,' the EAC-PM Chairman said.

articles.title: Budget 2026–27: PHDCCI calls for easier credit, lower compliance costs for MSMEs
articles.summary: Interest subvention, higher MUDRA limits and tax audit exemption for micro units among key asks

articles.title: India FY26 GDP first advance estimates see real growth at 7.4%, nominal GDP misses poll
articles.summary: In the first formal step towards framing the Union Budget, India’s FY26 GDP advance estimates peg real growth at 7.4%, driven by services, while nominal growth is seen at 8%.

articles.title: Govt signals capex push ahead of Budget with new three-year PPP pipeline
articles.summary: Ahead of the Union Budget, the Centre has unveiled a three-year PPP pipeline worth ₹17 lakh crore, signalling a renewed capex push and efforts to crowd in private investment across core infrastructure sectors.

articles.title: Budget flexibility hinges on nominal growth this year, economists caution
articles.summary: Low nominal GDP growth could complicate India’s Budget arithmetic despite strong real growth, with Morgan Stanley’s Upasana Chachra and HDFC Bank’s Sakshi Gupta outlining implications for fiscal deficit, spending and FY27 assumptions.

articles.title: India’s capex revival: Manufacturing, new-age sectors lead as services, infra lag
articles.summary: Economists Teresa John of Nirmal Bang and Sameer Narang of ICICI Bank analyse India's evolving capital expenditure landscape. While private capex is reviving, it's driven by new sectors like renewables, electronics, and data centres, contrasting with previous cycles. Metals are expected to remain a dominant theme, while the government is likely to maintain its spending at 3% of GDP, with a potential focus on railways and defence in the upcoming budget.

articles.title: Quick commerce’s next hurdle is gig worker security, say industry executives
articles.summary: India’s quick commerce boom faces a social security challenge as gig work scales rapidly, with TeamLease CFO Ramani Dathi and Updater Services COO Saravanan CR highlighting the trade-offs between worker benefits, platform costs, and flexibility.

articles.title: Japan's service sector growth slows in December, PMI shows
articles.summary: The S P Global final Japan Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 51.6 in December from 53.2 in November, worse than a flash reading of 52.5 but remaining above the 50.0 line that separates growth from contraction for the ninth consecutive month.

articles.title: CCI probe finds Tata Steel, JSW Steel, SAIL colluded on steel prices: Reuters report
articles.summary: India’s competition watchdog has found Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SAIL breached antitrust law by colluding on steel prices, a Reuters exclusive reported on Tuesday, exposing firms and executives to potential penalties.

articles.title: India’s FY26 real GDP growth seen at 7.5%, nominal at 8.3%: CNBC-TV18 poll
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, a CNBC-TV18 poll expects FY26 real GDP growth at 7.5% and nominal GDP growth at 8.3%.

articles.title: This one banking ratio is flashing a warning, but not a crisis
articles.summary: India’s loan-to-deposit ratio has hit a record 81.6%, signalling strong credit demand but rising liquidity stress for banks as loan growth outpaces deposits, raising concerns over margins, future lending capacity and policy transmission.

articles.title: Rate cuts may revive real estate stocks in 2026: Bernstein’s Venugopal Garre
articles.summary: Venugopal Garre, Managing Director and Head of India Research at Bernstein, said the macroeconomic environment remains stable and the economy is not collapsing, but warned that growth momentum is fading and upside potential is limited. Bernstein projects an 8% upside for the Nifty, with a target of 28,100.

articles.title: Rice exporters seek budget sops, interest subvention to boost competitiveness
articles.summary: Indian Rice Exporters asked Nirmala Sitharaman for tax breaks, interest aid, and freight support in Budget 2026 to boost exports and sector growth.

articles.title: India services PMI slips to 11-month low in December as demand and hiring weaken
articles.summary: The HSBC India Services Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), compiled by S P Global, slipped to 58.0 in December from 59.8 in November. The latest reading also came in below the flash estimate of 59.1. A PMI reading above 50 indicates expansion, while a print below that threshold signals contraction.

articles.title: Payments Regulatory Board: RBI charts vision for 2028 in first meeting
articles.summary: Members discussed the draft Payments Vision 2028, providing strategic guidance to further develop India’s fast-growing digital payment ecosystem where transaction volumes are projected to nearly triple by FY30.

articles.title: RBI to take over Delhi government’s banking operations, manage public debt
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will assume responsibility for the Delhi government’s banking operations and rupee public debt from January 9, 2026.

articles.title: India to grow above 7%, rate cut room limited but rupee outlook improves: Citi India
articles.summary: Citi India expects India to grow above 7% in real terms with inflation near 3.8%, leaving room for limited monetary easing. Chief Economist Samiran Chakraborty said the rupee outlook could improve if the balance of payments turns surplus, while the RBI’s focus in 2026 is likely to be on liquidity and policy guidance rather than aggressive rate cuts.

articles.title: ‘Uncertainty is the only certainty in 2026,’ says Demeter’s Ashwini Agarwal
articles.summary: Pankaj Tibrewal of IKIGAI Asset Manager and Ashwini Agarwal of Demeter Advisors said developments in Venezuela add to global uncertainty but have limited direct impact on India. They expect earnings recovery to drive Indian markets in 2026, remain positive on metals and commodities, and favour a bottom-up approach focused on mid and small caps.

articles.title: SBI to promote India-Israel trade in rupee
articles.summary: The SBI branch has held several meetings and organised webinars recently in collaboration with the Israel-India Chamber of Commerce to promote trade in rupees. It has also involved most of the major defence entities in Israel in these discussions.

articles.title: What to expect from India’s economy in 2026: Key signals from a CNBC-TV18 poll
articles.summary: The poll captures how leading economists see growth, inflation, fiscal trends and the rupee shaping up in 2026 amid rising global uncertainty.

articles.title: FPIs pull out ₹7,608 crore from equities in just 2 days of Jan
articles.summary: The withdrawal of funds followed the largest outflow of ₹1.66 lakh crore recorded in 2025, triggered by volatile currency movements, global trade tensions and concerns over potential US tariffs.

articles.title: No plan to change land acquisition policy, says cabinet secretary T V Somanathan
articles.summary: Officials said the PRAGATI platform has helped unlock stalled investments by resolving issues linked to land, environment and right of way, enabling large road, rail and power projects to move forward despite persistent structural challenges.

articles.title: PM Modi reviews progress on overseas critical mineral acquisitions, ₹1,500-crore recycling incentive scheme
articles.summary: The review covered India’s efforts to secure long-term access to key minerals such as lithium, cobalt and rare earths, while scaling up domestic recycling capacity to reduce import dependence and support manufacturing under the Make in India programme.

articles.title: Andhra now India’s top investment destination, grabs 25.3% of proposed capital in first 9 months
articles.summary: The report by Bank of Baroda noted that over half of India’s total proposed capital investment (51.2%) is concentrated in just three states — Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, and Maharashtra.

articles.summary: Chevron, Vitol, Trafigura and others vie for U.S. deals to export Venezuelan crude as Washington seeks indefinite control after capturing President Nicolas Maduro, reshaping global oil dynamics.

articles.title: China's Anta Sports offers to buy Pinault family's 29% Puma stake: report
articles.summary: Artemis had been expecting any offer for its Puma stake to exceed 40 euros a share, a fourth person with knowledge of the matter told Reuters. All four sources spoke on condition of anonymity because the matter is private.

In a conversation with CNBC-TV18, Executive Chairperson Tara Singh Vachani outlines how rising longevity, changing family structures and a growing focus on wellness are driving demand—while regulatory gaps and lack of standards remain the sector’s biggest scaling challenge.

articles.title: Power Mech Projects secures ₹3,126 crore battery storage orders from WBSEDCL

articles.title: Singapore Motorshow 2026 highlights electric ambition, luxury craftsmanship and performance innovation
articles.summary: Singapore Motorshow 2026 featured Suzuki e VITARA, MINI Nürburgring, Mercedes CLA, Porsche Cayenne Electric, Maybach SL 680, and AVATR 11.

articles.title: Sleeper coach buses to be manufactured by automobile cos, govt-accredited facilities: Gadkari
articles.summary: Existing sleeper coach buses will have to be retrofitted with fire detection systems, emergency exits with hammers, emergency lighting, and driver drowsiness indicators, he adds

articles.title: Retail holding in HDFC Bank drops to lowest level in 20 quarters
articles.summary: Retail investors are trimming HDFC Bank holdings as mutual funds, FPIs, and HNIs increase stakes, while high loan-to-deposit ratio and declining stock weigh on sentiment.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal raises ₹273 crore from anchor investors, allocates 11.88 crore shares
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal, a wholly owned subsidiary of Coal India, has raised ₹273.1 crore from anchor investors by allocating 11.88 crore equity shares at ₹23 per share ahead of its IPO opening on January 9, with 7.17 crore shares allotted to three domestic mutual funds through eight schemes.

articles.title: US control of Venezuelan oil threatens China’s Belt and Road loans, Caribbean caught in great power crossfire
articles.summary: The US intervention in Venezuela is reverberating beyond Latin America, threatening the stability of China’s Belt and Road loans and placing Caribbean nations in a delicate balancing act. While China’s immediate energy supply may remain largely intact, the long-term strategic and financial stakes are high, forcing regional players to navigate an increasingly fraught geopolitical landscape.

articles.title: Hindustan Unilever gets ₹1,560-crore income tax order for FY22
articles.summary: Hindustan Unilever has received an income tax assessment order with a demand of ₹1,559.69 crore for FY2021-22 related to transfer pricing and corporate tax adjustments, with the company stating there is no material financial or operational impact and that it will file an appeal within the stipulated timeline.

articles.title: Slightly more Americans file for jobless benefits in last week of 2025, but layoffs remain low
articles.summary: The number of Americans filing for jobless claims for the week ending January 3 rose by 8,000 to 2,08,000, up from 2,00,000 the previous week, the Labour Department reported Thursday.

articles.title: Bharat Electronics secures new orders worth ₹596 crore
articles.summary: Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) has secured additional orders worth ₹596 crore, including drone detection and jamming systems, mobile communication terminals, software solutions, upgrades, spares, and services, strengthening its defence electronics portfolio.

articles.title: UpGrad-Unacademy acquisition talks collapse over valuation differences: Report
articles.summary: The deal discussions broke down after both sides failed to agree on valuation expectations and the proposed structure, as per Moneycontrol.

articles.title: Power Grid wins project to boost renewable energy transmission in Karnataka
articles.summary: Power Grid Corporation has been declared the successful bidder under tariff-based competitive bidding to establish a 400 kV inter-state transmission system on a BOOT basis, strengthening the network to integrate 3GW of additional renewable energy at Davanagere (0.25 GW) and Bellary (2.75 GW) in Karnataka.

articles.title: Bharat Forge, Germany's Agile Robots sign MoU for AI-driven industrial automation
articles.summary: Bharat Forge and Germany-based Agile Robots have signed an MoU to explore a strategic collaboration in AI-driven robotics and intelligent industrial automation, focusing on co-developing bespoke manufacturing, logistics and CPG solutions for operations in India and Southeast Asia.

articles.title: From SEZ to DTA framework: A taxman clarifies the law interpreted by the Supreme Court
articles.summary: The Apex Court’s decision needs a careful study by the authorities concerned to ensure that in future there is no gap between intention and law; if the intention is to charge duty on such DTA clearances than it must be done under the charging section and not the exemption route, notes Najib Shah, former chairman, Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs.

articles.title: RVNL strengthens order book with ₹201-crore railway workshop project
articles.summary: Rail Vikas Nigam Limited received a ₹201.23 crore contract from East Coast Railway to set up a wagon POH workshop at Kantabanji, Odisha, with a capacity of 200 wagons in 18 months.

articles.title: Zoho founder asked to post $1.7 billion bond in divorce asset dispute, US Court’s 2025 order shows
articles.summary: A US court ordered Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu to post a $1.7 billion bond in his divorce case with Pramila Srinivasan, citing concerns over asset transfers and fair division of marital property.

articles.title: Prestige Estates signs agreement to buy 16.38-acre land parcel in Chennai
articles.summary: Prestige Estates, through its JV Canopy Living LLP, has signed an agreement to purchase a 16.381-acre land parcel in Padi, Chennai, near Anna Nagar, aligning with its strategy to strengthen presence in prime urban locations and support future residential and mixed-use development. Shares of Prestige Estates Projects Ltd ended at ₹1,583.80, down by ₹35.70, or 2.20%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Air India takes delivery of first Dreamliner after privatisation
articles.summary: Air India receives its first custom-made Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner since Tata Group takeover, marking a major fleet upgrade and expansion for the airline.

articles.title: Noida International Airport launch nears, but telecom connectivity remains uncertain
articles.summary: Noida International Airport in Jewar, set to open in January 2026, faces telecom disputes as NIA demands high fees from operators, similar to Adani-backed NMIA, sparking talks with telcos.

articles.title: Blood and barrels: 100 killed in Venezuela raid, Chevron’s oil push, China snubs Nvidia chips
articles.summary: Venezuela claims 100 killed in US raid to capture President Nicolas Maduro. Oil producer Chevron pushes on to expand in Venezuela. Meanwhile, China advises companies to halt Nvidia chip purchases for the week. Here are the top headlines of the day so far.

articles.title: SEBI alleges Bank of America shared confidential details in ABSL AMC stake sale: Reports
articles.summary: The report said SEBI had issued a show cause notice to Bank of America in November, alleging that the bank improperly circulated price sensitive information related to the sale of shares in Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC in 2024.

articles.title: RBI cancels registration of 35 NBFCs, accepts surrender from 16 others
articles.summary: RBI cancelled the Certificate of Registration of 35 NBFCs including Satya Prakash Capital Investment Limited and Sunlife Securities Private Limited for regulatory non-compliance.

articles.title: General insurance premiums rise over 13% in December; private sector sees growth
articles.summary: Private-sector general insurers reported a 14.8% rise in premiums to ₹23,748 crore, while state-owned insurers underwrote ₹10,126 crore, up 14.7% year-on-year.

articles.title: How MSME trends indicate a shift in India’s capital market landscape, shows SIDBI–Jocata report
articles.summary: India’s MSMEs are leveraging capital markets for growth, with NSE Emerge raising over ₹7,000 crore in FY25. Experts at SIDBI–Jocata Sumpoorn stress governance, data and liquidity for success.

articles.title: Beijing moves to curb reliance on US AI chips, halts Nvidia H200 purchases
articles.summary: China has asked select technology companies to temporarily stop purchasing Nvidia’s H200 artificial intelligence chips while policymakers assess future access to high-performance US semiconductors and encourage greater use of domestic alternatives.

articles.title: Apax makes first India consumer bet with iD Fresh Food as company targets ₹1,100 crore revenue, FY27 IPO
articles.summary: With Apax Funds coming on board, iD Fresh Food is sharpening its focus on profitability, distribution-led scale and global expansion ahead of a planned IPO in 2027. The deal, largely secondary in nature, signals rising private equity interest in India’s clean-label, fresh foods segment as iD looks to convert more households from homemade to ready-to-cook offerings.

articles.title: Boeing, Alaska Airlines seal largest fleet deal with 105 737-10 jets, five 787s
articles.summary: Boeing and Alaska Airlines announced the airline’s largest-ever aircraft order, comprising 105 737-10 jets with options for 35 more and five 787 Dreamliners, taking Alaska’s 737 MAX order book to 174 aircraft and its 787 orders to 12 as it expands domestic, international and long-haul networks.

articles.title: Top Stories | FY26 GDP estimates,  markets end flat, Trump on India tariffs and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm

articles.title: Angel One board to consider share split, interim dividend; record date set for January 21
articles.summary: Angel One’s board will meet on January 15 to consider a sub-division/split of its ₹10 equity shares and declare the first interim dividend for FY2025-26. The record date for the dividend is January 21, and the trading window will remain closed until January 17.

articles.title: US seizes 2 sanctioned oil tankers linked to Venezuela in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean
articles.summary: US European Command announced the seizure of the merchant vessel Bella 1 for “violations of US sanctions” in a social medial post.

articles.title: Bluspring targets over 20% annual growth post-demerger, revamps brand identity
articles.summary: For the full year, the company expects revenue to cross ₹3,400 crore, compared with around ₹3,000 crore in FY25, driven by new client additions and rising exposure to infrastructure led demand.

articles.title: Adani Green arm signs pact to supply 20.8 MW hybrid power to Asahi India Glass
articles.summary: Adani Green Energy Twenty Five B Ltd will supply 20.8 MW solar-wind hybrid power from Khavda to Asahi India Glass, with AIS subscribing to 26% equity as captive user under new agreements. Shares of Adani Green Energy ended marginally lower on Wednesday, January 7, by 0.05% at ₹1,018.90 on the NSE.

articles.title: Balaji Amines now eligible for ₹258-crore subsidy, waivers in Maharashtra unit expansion
articles.summary: Balaji Amines has received an eligibility certificate from the Maharashtra government under PSI-2013, making it eligible for ₹258 crore in industrial promotion subsidy, electricity duty exemption, and 100% stamp duty waiver for its unit-4 expansion at Chincholi MIDC for a period of seven years.

articles.title: 75% of AI fitness plan users in India are Gen Z, report shows
articles.summary: Gen Z drives 75% of AI-powered fitness plan subscriptions on boAt, showing a shift toward guided wellness. Walking, running, and the 20000-step challenge top activity trends in India.

articles.title: Apollo Hospitals, Max Health may see further earnings downgrades, bearish Macquarie warns
articles.summary: Shares of Apollo Hospitals and Max Healthcare have underperformed the Nifty 50 by 14% in 2025 so far. Macquarie expects further consensus earnings downgrades to continue weighing on the stocks in 2026.

articles.title: Rupee opens higher against dollar: What’s driving early gains
articles.summary: The Indian rupee opened at 89.87 against the U.S. dollar, buoyed by RBI intervention amid weak Asian cues, portfolio outflows, and U.S.-India trade tensions flagged by Donald Trump.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices cool in India: Why experts see this as a pause, not a reversal
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices fell in India as US dollar strength and global cues weighed on sentiment. Silver outperformed gold, driven by supply deficits and industrial demand.

articles.title: Reliance Industries' refining margin can improve further on Venezuela oil revival, Goldman says
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs expects moderation in RIL's retail earnings growth in Q3, citing weak discretionary spending, base effects and the timing of the festive season. However, this is likely to be partly offset by a strong, refining led performance in the energy business.

articles.title: Vodafone Idea shares see sharp fall from highs; Here's the AGR dues repayment timeline
articles.summary: The government is the largest shareholder in Vodafone Idea and has made it clear on multiple instances that they do not want a duopoly in the Indian telecom market, although, they have no intentions to increase their stake further beyond the current 49%.

articles.title: BHEL shares gain after bagging ₹5,400 crore order from JV with Coal India in Odisha
articles.summary: Although this is a related party transaction, UBS believes that it will have a positive read-through for BHEL as it is the first commercial use of the company's proprietary technology, taking the company towards the execution stage from R D.

articles.title: Why Indian markets should not be 'underweight': Bernstein's Rupal Agarwal explains
articles.summary: Thursday's sell-off on Dalal Street wiped out over ₹8 lakh crore in investor wealth, but despite the relentless FII selling, Rupal Agarwal of Bernstein believes that the Indian market does not warrant an "underweight" stance.

articles.title: Bansal Wire Industries shares in focus as 20% outstanding equity frees up for trade today
articles.summary: Around 31.3 million shares, or nearly 20% of the company's total outstanding equity, will become eligible for trading, according to Nuvama Alternative and Quantitative Research.

articles.title: IEX Market Coupling Case LIVE Updates: Stock falls over 7%, APTEL schedules next hearing for Jan 19
articles.summary: IEX Market Coupling Case LIVE Updates | APTEL has deferred the IEX vs CERC market coupling case hearing to Janaury 19. IEX is seeking withdrawal of the CERC's July 2025 order on day-ahead market coupling, which also triggered significant volatility in the IEX stock.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO: ₹1,071 crore issue opens with strong anchor demand, should you subscribe?
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal has raised ₹273.13 crore from anchor investors. Marquee institutions that participated in the anchor include LIC, Societe Generale, Copthall Mauritius Investment Ltd, Citrine Fund, M7 Global Fund PCC - ASAS Global Opportunities Fund, Maybank Securities and Rajasthan Global Securities.

articles.title: Oil prices extend gains as trader gauge Iran risks and Venezuela
articles.summary: The West Texas Intermediate rose over $58 a barrel after increased 3.2% in the earlier session. Meanwhile, Brent settled near $62.

articles.title: Asian shares edge higher ahead of US jobs data, tariff ruling
articles.summary: Equities opened in the green in Japan and Australia, while South Korea lagged. S P 500 witnessed a flat day on Thursday masked selling in tech behemoths such as Nvidia Corp. Treasury futures inched up and mortgage backed securities rallied after Trump said he was directing the purchase of $200 billion of mortgage bonds.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO Day 1: ₹1,071 crore subscribed 7x so far after full subscription in 20 minutes
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal has become the first mainboard IPO of 2026 on Dalal Street after a record year in 2025 that saw over 100 issues mop up more than ₹1.7 lakh crore.

articles.title: IREDA Q3 Results: All eyes on asset quality, QIP timeline after steady business update
articles.summary: While IREDA has declared the momentum seen in some of its major business metrics during its quarterly update release, the focus will be on the company's asset quality, which had deteriorated sharply during the June quarter due to the Gensol Engineering issue but improved marginally in September.

articles.title: Dow Jones gains 300 points, Smallcaps rally ahead of tariff verdict, jobs report
articles.summary: Wall Street remains in wait-and-watch mode ahead of two very important announcements scheduled for Friday evening Indian time. Oil prices though, are staging a rebound.

articles.title: Paramount says Warner Bros cable channels are worth nothing
articles.summary: Paramount pointed to the poor market debut of Versant Media Group Inc, the cable networks spun out of Comcast Corp., which began trading earlier this week. Its shares have declined about 30% in the first few days of trading.

articles.title: Which sectors saw FII inflows and outflows in December 2025
articles.summary: Foreign institutional investors remained net sellers across most sectors in December, led by BFSI and FMCG, while services, metals and IT attracted selective inflows, JM Financial’s FII monthly tracker showed.

articles.title: UGRO Capital board approves scheme to merge subsidiary Profectus Capital
articles.summary: The merger, subject to regulatory and stakeholder approvals, aims to strengthen asset quality, enhance operational efficiency, and drive long-term sustainable growth.

articles.title: Reliance Industries to announce Q3 results on January 16
articles.summary: Reliance Industries Limited will announce Q3 and nine-month financial results on January 16, 2026, with a board meeting and analysts' meet following the disclosure. The company's shares closed lower on January 8.

articles.title: ED raids I-PAC office: Mamata to lead protests as court battle set to begin
articles.summary: Addressing the controversy, Banerjee accused the ED of overreach, claiming sensitive party material had been seized during the operation.

articles.title: Will never part ways: Uddhav Thackeray on unity with Raj
articles.summary: Coming together politically for the first time in nearly two decades, Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray last month announced an alliance ahead of the January 15 polls in Mumbai and 28 other municipal corporations in Maharashtra.

articles.title: BJP promises to freeze water, property taxes for 20 years in Navi Mumbai
articles.summary: Navi Mumbai is the only self-sufficient municipal corporation in India regarding water resources, Chavan noted.

articles.title: Mumbai votes on January 15 as BMC polls return after four years
articles.summary: Experts say that despite confusing alliances, voters are unlikely to be influenced by political math. Instead, campaigns are being driven by big narratives such as turning Mumbai into a global city, Hindutva, and Marathi pride.

articles.title: Centre replaced MGNREGA to provide cheap labour to corporates: CM Revanth Reddy
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy on Thursday claimed that the NDA government at the Centre replaced the MGNREGA with VB G RAM G to ensure availability of cheap labour for big corporates by stripping the rural poor of their right to work.

articles.title: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee obstructed raids in coal smuggling case: ED
articles.summary: The searches were conducted based on a CBI Kolkata FIR filed in November 2020 against Anup Majee and others, and the ED had registered an ECIR in the same month.

articles.title: Vasai Virar civic polls: Voters to get discounts on hotels, transport on polling day
articles.summary: Describing elections as a "festival of democracy," the commissioner appealed to representatives of various associations to support the democratic process by offering incentives to voters on polling day in Maharashtra's Vasai-Virar civic areas.

articles.title: High drama in Kolkata | ED raids I-PAC office, Mamata slams 'nasty, naughty' Amit Shah
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is conducting searches at 15 locations across India in a fake government job scam against an organised gang involved in scamming people by offering fake jobs.

articles.title: BMC elections: Assets of key candidates record sharp rise since 2017
articles.summary: From former Mumbai mayor and Shiv Sena (UBT) candidate Kishori Pednekar to former BJP corporator Neil Somaiya and Congress candidate Sheetal Mhatre, the assets of key candidates contesting in BMC Elections 2026 have seen an exponential growth. Read on:

articles.title: Congress appoints Shivakumar, Baghel, Tirkey as senior observers for Assam polls
articles.summary: The announcement comes close on the heels of appointing Lok Sabha MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra as the chairperson of the screening committee for the Assam polls.

articles.title: Maharashtra civic polls: MMRDA transformed from 'bank' to infrastructure powerhouse, says Fadnavis
articles.summary: ”MMRDA is not a bank; it was created to fund and build infrastructure across the entire metropolitan area,” the Chief Minister stated. Fadnavis said he and his deputy Eknath Shinde have initiated projects worth ₹4 lakh crore through the MMRDA, focusing on water schemes, roads, and an expansive metro network.

articles.title: Aaditya Thackeray accuses Shinde-Fadnavis govt of scams, delays in key Mumbai projects
articles.summary: Aaditya Thackeray accused the Shinde–Fadnavis government of scams, cost overruns and delays in Mumbai’s key infrastructure projects, highlighting stalled roads, Gokhale Bridge issues, and slow progress on the northbound coastal road.

articles.title: Will continue in politics till I have people's blessings: Siddaramaiah
articles.summary: In his second term as chief minister, the 77-year-old Congress leader surpassed Devaraj Urs' record as the longest-serving CM of the state for 2,792 days.

articles.title: Congress suspends 12 councillors over alliance with BJP in Ambernath
articles.summary: Congress suspended 12 Ambernath councillors for allying with BJP in civic polls, sparking controversy in Maharashtra's Mahayuti. Devendra Fadnavis and Eknath Shinde condemned the alliances.

articles.title: BJP's alliance with Congress, AIMIM in Maharashtra: Fadnavis warns of action, Cong suspends local leaders
articles.summary: BJP's alliance with Congress and AIMIM in Maharashtra sparks political chaos as CM Devendra Fadnavis warns leaders and Congress suspends members. Read on:

articles.title: PMK joins AIADMK-led NDA ahead of Tamil Nadu Assembly Elections 2026
articles.summary: PMK joins AIADMK-led NDA for Tamil Nadu Assembly elections 2026, announced by Edappadi Palaniswami and Anbumani Ramadoss in Chennai, aiming to challenge MK Stalin-led DMK.

articles.title: BJP allies with Congress in Ambernath civic body to keep Shinde's Shiv Sena out
articles.summary: Leaders from the Shinde group criticised the BJP for what they termed an “indecent alliance,” accusing it of political betrayal. BJP VP Gulabrao Karanjule Patil rejected the criticism, stating that aligning with the Shinde group allegedly involved in corruption for the past 25 years would have been inappropriate.

articles.title: Aaditya Thackeray flags wildlife risks as Maharashtra clears mining near tiger corridor
articles.summary: The opposition has raised concerns over the economic and environmental trade-offs of the proposed iron ore project, arguing that limited job creation and output do not justify potential damage to critical wildlife corridors in eastern Maharashtra.

articles.title: Jharkhand joins Punjab, Karnataka in opposing Centre’s new VB-G RAM G Act
articles.summary: The Jharkhand government has hardened its stance against the Centre’s new rural employment framework, with Chief Minister Hemant Soren warning that any changes undermining wage security, work guarantees and state autonomy could worsen livelihood stress and migration in tribal and rural regions.

articles.title: Manipur Congress MP alleges ‘illegal buffer zones’ dividing state under centre’s watch
articles.summary: The Congress has sharpened its attack on the Centre over the handling of Manipur, with MP A Bimol Akoijam alleging that buffer zones enforced by central forces are restricting movement and deepening ethnic divisions. The remarks come amid continued security concerns and President’s rule in the violence-hit state.

articles.title: Lucknow court hears arguments in complaint challenging Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship
articles.summary: A special MP/MLA court in Lucknow is examining a complaint that questions Rahul Gandhi’s eligibility as a Lok Sabha MP, with the complainant pressing for cancellation of his election from Rae Bareli. The proceedings follow the transfer of the case from Rae Bareli to Lucknow on security grounds.

articles.title: Assam Congress protests draft voter roll, alleges irregularities after special revision
articles.summary: The publication of Assam’s integrated draft electoral roll has triggered political protests, with the Congress alleging manipulation to benefit the ruling BJP. The Election Commission has defended the process, noting that additions and deletions identified during the Special Revision will be addressed during the claims and objections period before the final roll is issued.

articles.title: Economist Amartya Sen not required to attend SIR hearing over spelling error, says EC
articles.summary: The Election Commission (EC) on Tuesday clarified that Nobel laureate Amartya Sen, who was reportedly summoned by the EC over discrepancies in the spelling of his name in the voter list, is not required to appear for a hearing, an official said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Pothole-free Mumbai by end-2026 is my promise: Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde
articles.summary: With civic polls around the corner, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said large-scale concretisation of roads is underway across Mumbai and assured that infrastructure disruptions will ease as projects near completion over the next year.

articles.title: Maharashtra Civic Body Polls: How to find your local voting booth
articles.summary: There are several ways in which voters can find out which polling booth has their name listed.

articles.title: Cancel elections where candidates won unopposed, hold polls again in such wards: Uddhav to SEC
articles.summary: Speaking along side Maharashtra Navnirman Sena president Raj Thackeray, Uddhav claimed the atmosphere in the country is like democracy has been taken over by mobocracy.

articles.title: Introspect before levelling allegations: BJP hits out at Ajit Pawar over 'corruption' allegations
articles.summary: If the Bharatiya Janata Party starts making allegations, it would create serious difficulties for him (Pawar), Chavan said, and advised the NCP chief to "introspect" before levelling allegations.

articles.title: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor defends Karnataka govt’s stand on Bengaluru demolition drive
articles.summary: Tharoor said notices had been issued to the residents before the demolition. He said he did not see justice in politically projecting the issue only on the basis that the affected people were poor. "The government has taken a decision to provide temporary accommodation and has promised permanent housing within five to six months,” he said.

articles.title: Thane civic polls see 649 candidates in fray after mass withdrawals
articles.summary: The final list of candidates highlights sharp contrasts across Thane’s wards, with some constituencies witnessing intense competition while others saw significant pruning due to withdrawals and invalid nominations. Election officials said the uneven spread reflects both strategic exits and stricter scrutiny of nomination papers.

articles.title: RSS not a para-military organisation, says Mohan Bhagwat
articles.summary: ”A false narrative is being built against the Sangh. Nowadays, people do not go deep to gather the right information. They do not go to the origin. They go to Wikipedia. Everything is not true out there. Those who go to reliable sources will get to know about the Sangh,” he said.

articles.title: Rajnath Singh flags 'alarming trend' of educated people indulging in anti-national activities
articles.summary: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said that an alarming trend of white-collar terrorism is emerging in the country, wherein highly-educated people are engaging in anti-social and anti-national activities.

articles.title: CAG flags fiscal transparency gaps as Centre’s debt remains elevated
articles.summary: Audit flags fiscal transparency gaps as Centre’s debt stays above pre-pandemic levels, breaches FRBM targets, disclosure inconsistencies persist, and interest costs strain public finances economy.

articles.title: Key elections, census and more: 10 political developments India will see in 2026
articles.summary: India’s 2026 political calendar is packed with state elections, Census, delimitation debates, key Bills and leadership changes. Here’s what to watch.

articles.title: Congress chief Kharge criticises BJP over ‘plunder, corruption and misgovernance’ in 2025
articles.summary: In a sharp year-end critique, the Congress president accused the NDA government of economic mismanagement, institutional erosion and social distress, arguing that rising inequality, unemployment and governance failures continued to weigh on citizens through 2025.

articles.title: Politicians who went viral in 2025: Speeches, gaffes and defining moments
articles.summary: From PM Modi’s speech after the Pahalgam attack to Zohran Mamdani’s NYC mayor win and Rekha Gupta’s AQI moments, check the politicians who went viral in 2025 and for what.

articles.title: How Delhi, Bihar and VP polls reshaped India's political landscape in 2025
articles.summary: Taken together, the Delhi and Bihar verdicts have further weakened Opposition cohesion at the national level. Repeated electoral setbacks have reduced the Congress's leverage within Opposition alliances, while regional parties are increasingly prioritising state-specific strategies over a unified national front.

articles.title: If Cong high command has to decide on leadership, they should do it before Feb: Parameshwara
articles.summary: G Parameshwara says Congress high command must decide on Karnataka leadership before February budget prep. Siddaramaiah aims for 17th Budget amid CM change speculations. Shivakumar also in contention.

articles.title: BMC Elections 2026: AAP manifesto promises free water, power, pothole-free roads, lots more
articles.summary: Aam Aadmi Party unveils ‘Kejriwal chi Guarantee’ manifesto for BMC polls, promising free water, electricity, modern schools, 1,000 mohalla clinics, and transparent governance in Mumbai.

articles.title: BMC Elections 2026: BJP gets flak for fielding kin of Maharashtra Speaker Rahul Narwekar
articles.summary: BJP faces criticism for fielding Rahul Narwekar's relatives in BMC elections, despite opposing dynastic politics. Makarand, Harshita, and Gauravi Shivalkar-Narwekar get tickets.

articles.title: BMC Elections 2026: Congress releases two lists of candidates, check details
articles.summary: Congress announced 126 candidates for BMC Elections 2026 after seat-sharing with Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi. Allies RSP and NCP also declared nominees. Polls are set for January 15 in Mumbai.

articles.title: D K Shivakumar to become Karnataka CM in early January, claims Congress MLA
articles.summary: Fresh comments by a Congress legislator have reignited speculation over a possible leadership transition in Karnataka, even as Chief Minister Siddaramaiah maintains he will continue in office and party leaders cite an internal agreement brokered by the high command.

articles.title: ‘Parivar Together’: Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar come together for Pimpri-Chinchwad civic polls
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar and Sharadchandra Pawar factions of NCP unite for Pimpri-Chinchwad polls, focusing on development, while NCP contests Mumbai elections solo ahead of January 15 civic polls.

articles.title: BMC Elections 2026: Ajit Pawar's NCP announces first list of candidates, check details
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar-led NCP released its first list of 37 candidates for BMC 2026 polls, contesting solo amid strained ties with BJP. Mahayuti finalised seat-sharing, polls on January 15, 2026.

articles.title: Congress 140th foundation day: Mallikarjun Kharge says Congress is an ideology and 'ideologies never die'
articles.summary: Congress marks 140th Foundation Day as Mallikarjun Kharge highlights its enduring ideology, historic milestones, and commitment to democracy and unity.

articles.title: West Bengal Guv CV Ananda Bose gets death threat, security tightened
articles.summary: West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose receives death threat email; security tightened. CM Mamata Banerjee and Union Home Ministry informed.

articles.title: Modi to launch cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims, says Nitin Gadkari
articles.summary: Nitin Gadkari announced Prime Minister Narendra Modi will soon launch a nationwide cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims, offering up to ₹1.5 lakh per victim for seven days.

articles.title: DYK | Freedom At Midnight: If Mountbatten had known Jinnah was dying, Partition may never have happened
articles.summary: Years after presiding over the hurried and bloody Partition of India in 1947, Mountbatten, the last Viceroy of British India, made a confession. In a conversation with Dominique Lapierre, co-author of 'Freedom at Midnight,' Mountbatten reflected on how differently he would have handled the transfer of power had he known what Jinnah was hiding.

articles.title: Average asset of 102 re-elected MPs rises by 110% between 2014-2024: ADR
articles.summary: According to the report, Bhonsle, who was elected in 2014 and 2019 as an MP from the Nationalist Congress Party, and from the BJP in 2024 from Satara in Maharashtra, registered an increase of 268% in his assets

articles.title: Govt says rescue fund helped turn 61,000 half-built homes into finished homes
articles.summary: The government also claimed that construction activity under these projects generated demand for more than 20 lakh tonnes of cement and 5.5 lakh metric tonnes of steel.

articles.title: I-PAC chief Pratik Jain’s family files police complaint alleging theft during ED raids at home
articles.summary: The family of Pratik Jain, chief of political consultancy firm IPAC, on Thursday filed a police complaint against the Enforcement Directorate (ED), alleging theft of important documents during a raid at home, an officer said.

articles.title: Over ₹1.52 lakh cr locked in Customs disputes; govt may look at amnesty scheme in FY27 Budget
articles.summary: Price Waterhouse and Gautam Khattar suggest an amnesty scheme and customs duty rationalisation in Budget 2026-27 to resolve ₹1.52 lakh crore litigations and address duty inversion from FTAs.

articles.title: ED links Bengal's Shakambhari Group to illegal coal supply from ECL areas
articles.summary: ED identifies Shakambhari Group as a key end-user of illegally mined coal from ECL areas, probing money laundering links to Anup Majee, I-PAC, and political tensions involving Mamata Banerjee.

articles.title: Census 2027: Why your house will be counted before you; what if you own multiple houses
articles.summary: The 2027 Census, led by Commissioner Mrityunjay Kumar Narayan, will start with house-listing from April to September 2026, using digital tools and including caste data for the first time.

articles.title: Sergio Gor to take charge as US ambassador to India on Jan 12
articles.summary: Gor's appointment comes at a sensitive moment in India–US ties which has come under biggest strain over trade issues. He succeeds Eric Garcetti, who stepped down earlier in 2025, leaving the embassy without a permanent ambassador for much of the past year.

articles.title: D&B spots India's future growth drivers: AI, clean energy and new-age sectors
articles.summary: The country is poised to transition from steady expansion to a phase of deeper, more diversified transformation, with GDP growth projected at around 6.6% by FY2027, says report

articles.title: Economics will decide India's Russian oil buys, not US rhetoric: Ex-HPCL Chief
articles.summary: MK Surana, former CMD of HPCL, urged caution on the proposed tariff framework, saying its impact will depend on the final wording, the products covered and how it is implemented across countries and contexts.

articles.title: Germany and India on verge of $8 billion submarine agreement
articles.summary: India’s navy operates about a dozen aging Russian submarines and six new French-made models. If the deal under discussion goes ahead, India would scrap plans to buy three more French subs.

articles.title: Modi urges ethical, inclusive AI as India’s start-ups take centre stage ahead of global summit
articles.summary: Prime minister tells founders they are “co-architects of India’s future” and calls for home-grown models rooted in local languages and values.

articles.title: 30 people fall sick in Greater Noida after drinking 'contaminated' water – More on it
articles.summary: This comes days after sewage-contaminated drinking water claimed the lives of at least 10 people in Indore.

articles.title: Pune polls: BJP promises concession on city buses, Metro for women, tax relief for small properties
articles.summary: The manifesto titled ’Sankalp Patra’ was unveiled on Wednesday in the presence of the party’s Pune Lok Sabha MP Murlidhar Mohol, state ministers Chandrakant Patil and Madhuri Misal

articles.title: Civic polls: Fadnavis pledges to ease traffic, fast-track Metro projects in Thane, MMR
articles.summary: Devendra Fadnavis pledges to ease MMR traffic, complete Metro projects by 2030, resolve water issues with Gargai and Kalu Dam, and strengthen BJP-Shiv Sena alliance for Thane polls.

articles.title: Mamata dares BJP to fight TMC politically to win West Bengal polls; protest across state at 4 pm today
articles.summary: ED raided I-PAC and Pratik Jain's home in Kolkata; Mamata Banerjee called it political vendetta and announced protests. Suvendu Adhikari criticized her.

articles.title: Majority of Indian professionals plan to switch jobs in 2026, many feel unprepared: LinkedIn
articles.summary: LinkedIn reports 84 percent of Indian professionals feel unprepared for AI-driven hiring in 2026, as competition doubles and roles like Prompt Engineer and AI Engineer see rising demand.

articles.title: Fake government job scam: ED raids multiple locations across five states
articles.summary: Enforcement Directorate raided 15 locations across five states, busting a fake government job scam linked to Indian Railways, Forest Department, RRB, India Post, and more. Investigation continues.

articles.title: Who was Madhav Gadgil, the noted ecologist who passed away at 83
articles.summary: Historian Ramanchandra Guha, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge as well as ecologists and environmental leaders have paid tribute to the the life and legacy of Madhav Gadgil.

articles.title: 12 suspended Congress councillors in Ambernath switch to BJP
articles.summary: Twelve Ambernath Municipal Council councillors suspended by Congress for joining BJP formally entered BJP, shifting local power and sparking criticism from Shiv Sena over coalition dharma.

articles.title: What does Satat Sampada do? Why ED raided the house of its co-founders
articles.summary: The ED raided the house of Satat Sampada NGO co-founders on charges of foreign funding with the intent of influencing government policy.

articles.title: 'Marathi manoos' will be powerless if BJP controls civic bodies, says Raj Thackeray
articles.summary: In the Saamana interview, Raj Thackeray said those from outside the state are not just coming for livelihood, but they are forming their own constituencies. "It is an old wound…efforts are on to realise the dream of separating Mumbai from Maharashtra," he claimed.

articles.title: Mumbai Local capacity boost? Western Railway conducts safety trials for 18-coach EMU trains
articles.summary: Western Railway will conduct safety trials for 18-coach EMU trains on the Virar–Dahanu Road section, testing Bombardier and Medha systems to boost Mumbai suburban capacity.

articles.title: UP SIR: Lucknow, Ghaziabad top in delisted voters; fewer deletions in Muslim-dominated pockets
articles.summary: Lucknow, Ghaziabad, Balrampur, and Kanpur Nagar led Uttar Pradesh districts in uncollected electoral forms during SIR, with 2.89 crore voters excluded from the draft roll.

articles.title: Oxford University Press apologises to Shivaji Maharaj's descendant over unverified content in 2003 book
articles.summary: Oxford University Press (OUP) India has issued an apology over certain "unverified statements" published in a 2003 book on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, more than 20 years after his 13th descendant, Udayanraje Bhosale, filed a complaint in a court in Maharashtra’s Satara district.

articles.title: Lucid, Nuro and Uber unveil production-ready robotaxi at CES 2026
articles.summary: With Lucid, Nuro and Uber unveiling production-ready robotaxis, the race to make driverless rides mainstream in the US is clearly speeding up. The unveiling at the CES technology conference in Las Vegas places the trio, alongside Alphabet's Waymo and Elon Musk's Tesla, among others.

articles.title: China to probe Meta’s $2 bn acquisition of AI startup Manus amid rising tech curbs
articles.summary: China’s Ministry of Commerce is investigating Meta’s acquisition of Manus over compliance concerns, highlighting increased scrutiny of foreign tech deals and AI sector regulations.

articles.title: This lollipop plays music inside your head
articles.summary: Lava Tech Brands unveiled Lollipop Star at CES 2026, a candy using bone-conduction tech to play music inside your head, featuring tracks by Ice Spice, Akon, and Armani White.

articles.title: CES 2026: Samsung unveils the Galaxy Z Trifold, Merach launches UltraTread T70 Aura and Nylo
articles.summary: In its latest step in foldable innovation, Samsung unveiled the Galaxy Z Trifold at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas.

articles.title: OpenAI introduces ChatGPT Health: What is it and how it works
articles.summary: OpenAI has launched ChatGPT Health, a private, secure space where users can connect medical records and wellness apps to manage health information.

articles.title: Samsung’s rolling Ballie robot indefinitely shelved after delays
articles.summary: Samsung Electronics Co. has sidelined Ballie, its long-awaited home robot, at CES despite past demos and a Google partnership, focusing instead on smart home tech and ambient AI innovations.

articles.title: X responds to MeitY over sexually explicit content generated by Grok
articles.summary: Platform cites user misuse, assures action against violations as government weighs next steps

articles.title: Researchers develop AI model that predicts disease risk from sleep data
articles.summary: More than 1,000 disease categories in the health records were looked at and 130 could be predicted with reasonable accuracy using a patient’s sleep data.

articles.title: Infosys, Cognition partner to deploy AI software agent Devin globally
articles.summary: Under the partnership, Infosys will deploy Devin across its internal engineering ecosystem and embed the AI agent within client delivery models worldwide. Shares of Infosys closed at ₹1,640, rising ₹27.80, or 1.72%, on January 7.

articles.title: Google AI messes up 2026, Elon Musk weighs in with quick verdict
articles.summary: A user asked Google search, “Is it 2027 next year?” The AI replied, “No, 2027 is not next year. 2026 is the next year, and 2027 will be the year after that, a common year starting on Friday, according to the Gregorian calendar.”

articles.title: CES 2026: Robots dance to K-pop, do laundry, and steal the show | Watch
articles.summary: The world's largest consumer tech event saw promising new launches from top electronics and robotics companies. Robots stole the show for dancing to the beats of K-pop songs to performing everyday mundane tasks with precision.

articles.title: Elon Musk’s xAI closes $20 billion funding with Nvidia backing
articles.summary: Wall Street bankers will be able to recover their investment by using the vehicle to purchase Nvidia processors, which xAI will then rent out for five years.The distinctive deal structure, supported by the GPUs rather than the company, might provide a model for tech companies trying to reduce their debt exposure.

articles.title: Grok obscene AI content: Govt gives X time till January 7 to submit report
articles.summary: The government has given X additional time till January 7 to submit a detailed Action Taken Report after it issued a stern warning to the Elon Musk-led social media platform over indecent and sexually-explicit content being generated through misuse of AI-based services like 'Grok' and other tools.

articles.title: DIY Dream Recorders: Watch how you can turn your dreams into a movie
articles.summary: A Dream Recorder is a bedside device that records your dreams while you sleep and plays them back like a short movie.

articles.title: AI image misuse is rising. Here’s how to stay safe online
articles.summary: While Elon Musk's Grok face probe in India and Europe, the urgent question for users is how to stay safe from AI misuse. Understanding how AI image misuse happens is the first step.

articles.title: Redmi launches Note 15 5G in Indian market: Know features, prices
articles.summary: Xiaomi Redmi’s latest offering in its Note 15 series has been revealed and has a high pixel camera as its most defining feature.

articles.title: Global tech companies, startups showcase breakthrough innovations in AI, robotics at CES 2026
articles.summary: The biggest names in technology such as global brands AMD, BMW, John Deere, Lenovo, LG, Qualcomm, Samsung as well as startups from around the world will be showcasing their cutting-edge technology and solutions.

articles.title: Nvidia launches new, more powerful Vera Rubin chip at CES 2026: All about it
articles.summary: The Rubin architecture is a six-chip system that combines a Vera CPU and two Rubin GPUs, offering significant improvements in speed and power efficiency.

articles.title: Samsung working towards unified AI experience for all products, services: New Co-CEO
articles.summary: Consumer electronics major Samsung, which ships around 500 million devices each year across several categories, including mobile phones, appliances, and displays, will embed Artificial Intelligence (AI) across every product and category, its co-CEO T M Roh said.

articles.title: COAI raises concerns over direct-to-mobile tech test by Prasar Bharati without engaging telcos
articles.summary: COAI criticizes Prasar Bharati's D2M broadcast tech test for lacking telecom and device industry involvement, urging transparent, inclusive evaluation for spectrum and network impact.

articles.title: 'Zero scientific standing': AIIMS doctor on Deepinder Goyal’s Temple wearable healthtech
articles.summary: Deepinder Goyal’s experimental wearable Temple, 'designed to measure blood flow to the brain,' sparked debate online and drew sharp criticism from a doctor-researcher of AIIMS Delhi.

articles.title: Realme 16 Pro series launch tomorrow: Know expected pricing and premium features
articles.summary: Realme 16 Pro series will include two devices, the Realme 16 Pro 5G and Realme 16 Pro+ 5G.

articles.summary: The government has demanded that X undertake a comprehensive and immediate technical review of Grok including how it processes prompts and creation capabilities so as to not facilitate sexually explicit, unlawful content.

articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: Govt considering law to regulate social media after Grok AI misuse: IT Minister
articles.summary: Rajya Sabha MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has raised the issue with Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, urging him to curb such gross misuse of AI and to prioritise the matter to ensure women’s safety.

articles.title: Why people feel this drone show in China's Chongqing is way better than fireworks | Video
articles.summary: Held along Chongqing’s illuminated riverfront, the show went far beyond conventional light displays.

articles.title: Electronics PLI: Local design a must, daily progress calls likely: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: In a firm statement to the industry, the minister emphasized that advancements on these objectives will be monitored rigorously, noting that businesses should expect daily review calls from his office to guarantee that timelines and commitments are fulfilled.

articles.title: Neuralink plans 'high-volume' brain implant production by 2026, Musk says
articles.summary: The company began human trials of its brain implant in 2024 after addressing safety concerns raised by the US Food and Drug Administration, which had initially rejected its application in 2022.

articles.summary: Concerns grew around a disturbing trend on X where users were asking Grok to morph photographs of women and children into sexually compromising images. The manipulated images were then shared without consent, leaving victims exposed to harassment and humiliation.

articles.summary: Budget 2026 could mark a turning point in India’s AI journey—by backing deployment, skilling, compute access, and multilingual datasets, India can move beyond pilots to become the world’s most important AI proving ground, notes Apurv Agrawal, Co-Founder and CEO of SquadStack.ai.

articles.title: January 2026 tech launches: Redmi Note 15 5G, Motorola Signature and Poco M8
articles.summary: January 2026 will see a packed tech launch window in India, with multiple brands like Redmi and Motorola rolling out phones and a tablet across price segments in the first two weeks.

articles.summary: X is facing backlash after users exploited its Grok AI to morph photos of women and children into explicit images, sparking global concern over AI-driven sexual abuse and platform safety.

articles.title: Best smartphones of 2025 and upcoming devices to watch out for in 2026

articles.summary: CES 2026 in Las Vegas will feature AI-focused launches from Samsung, LG, Intel, AMD, NVIDIA, Sony and Lenovo. Apple will mark its 50th anniversary with major product releases and AI-powered Apple Glasses.

articles.title: Cybersecurity 2025: Major breaches, data leaks and lessons

articles.title: Musk's xAI buys third building to expand AI compute power
articles.summary: Elon Musk's xAI buys a third building called MACROHARDRR near Memphis to expand Colossus supercomputer, aiming for 2 gigawatts compute power and 1 million GPUs, sparking environmental concerns.

articles.title: Elon Musk hints X may soon pay creators more than YouTube
articles.summary: Elon Musk has signalled plans to raise creator payouts on X beyond YouTube levels, asking product head Nikita Bier to enforce stricter anti-fraud rules.

articles.title: Credit card spending rises over 11% in November: CareEdge flags key drivers
articles.summary: India’s credit card spending rose 11.5% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in November 2025, driven by deeper card penetration and digital usage, as per CareEdge Ratings, despite post-festive moderation.

articles.title: JioBlackRock MF launches low and short duration debt funds

articles.summary: Bandhan AMC launches Arudha Hybrid Long-Short Fund under SIF, blending debt and market-neutral equity for stability and arbitrage. Units to be listed on NSE and BSE for investor access.

articles.title: India Post Payments Bank to roll out investment platform in partnership with Choice Wealth
articles.summary: India Post Payments Bank partners with Choice Wealth to launch a digital investment platform, offering mutual funds and robo-advisory services to over 11 crore customers nationwide.

articles.title: Home loan EMIs may fall as HDFC Bank cuts MCLR by up to 5 bps
articles.summary: HDFC Bank cuts MCLR by up to 5 basis points on select tenures from January 7, 2026, lowering EMIs for borrowers. MCLR now ranges from 8.25 percent to 8.55 percent.

articles.title: UIDAI launches ‘Udai’: How the Aadhaar mascot will help users access services

articles.summary: Nithin Kamath of Zerodha urges retail investors to track IPO lock-in periods, warning of stock price drops when large shareholders sell after expiry, now tracked on Zerodha's Kite platform.

articles.title: Budget 2026: ICAI seeks review of personal tax surcharge limits and deductions
articles.summary: ICAI urges Union Budget reforms in individual taxation, advocating health insurance deductions, higher surcharge thresholds, disability relief, and optional joint taxation for married couples.

articles.title: Policybazaar launches online home loan insurance: How it works and cuts premium costs
articles.summary: Home loan insurance is intended to cover outstanding loan amounts in the event of a borrower’s death.

articles.title: How to transfer overseas education fees on the same day
articles.summary: BookMyForex enables same-day international transfers for overseas education payments, reducing delays and penalties. Cashback up to ₹15000 offered for transactions above ₹3 lakh via digital platforms.

articles.summary: Supreme Court directs Centre and EPFO to review the ₹15000 EPF wage ceiling, unchanged since 2014, impacting retirement savings for millions of salaried employees across India.
